title: A new Mandarin Oriental moors at Lake Como - but is it ready to deliver a world-class experience?
text:
Lake Como may be one of the most beautiful holiday destinations in the world, but back in the 19th century the wealthy gentry building villas there all seemed to be dreaming of China, plastering their homes in chinoiserie.

The flamboyant decorative style was seen to convey a sense of cultural sophistication and while that vogue has dissipated in the many decades since, this summer marked a return of sorts – and one that may induce another ripple of change to Lake Como’s classic sensibilities.

Until this year, Lake Como’s luxury hotels were family-owned or otherwise small in scale. But in April, the first multinational luxury behemoth made its debut. What had previously been the CastaDiva resort...
description: Lake Como may be one of the most beautiful holiday destinations in the world, but back in the 19th century the wealthy gentry building villas there all seemed to be dreaming of China, plastering their homes in chinoiserie.
